setting.conf_title_desc: These settings will allow you to enter ad codes that can then be displayed throughout your forum

setting.conf_description: This setting will allow you to globally enable or disable the ad system
Any groups that you select here will not be shown ads
This code will be inserted into the header of every page
This code will be inserted into the footer of every page
Using this setting, you can replace the global header code with code specific for this section.
Using this setting, you can replace the global footer code with code specific for this section.
This code will be displayed in the board index sidebar
Using this setting, you can replace the global header code with code specific for this section.
Using this setting, you can replace the global footer code with code specific for this section.

setting.conf_title: Code to display after first topic
setting.conf_description: This ad code will be displayed after the first topic
Using this setting, you can replace the global header code with code specific for this section.
Using this setting, you can replace the global footer code with code specific for this section.

setting.conf_title: Code to display after first post
setting.conf_description: This code will be displayed after the first post in a topic

setting.conf_title_desc: Configure settings for Admob integration with the IPS Mobile App

setting.conf_description: This is the publisher ID issued to you by Google when you sign up for Admob. Click here for instructions
Enabling this option will show an ad at the top of the screen in the IPS Mobile App
Enabling this option will show ads at the bottom of the IPS Mobile App

setting.conf_title_desc: Settings for archive functionality
This section allows you to maintain your community guidelines.

setting.conf_title: Show link to guidelines in footer
External http:// link to guidelines page
setting.conf_description: Enter the URL to a set of external guidelines or if you wish to add your guidelines below simply leave this box clear.
Only applies if not using an external guidelines link. HTML Enabled
The content of this section will be displayed before a member can register a new account. HTML ENABLED
setting.conf_default:
Forum Terms & Rules
Please take a moment to review these rules detailed below. If you agree with them and wish to proceed with the registration, simply click the "Register" button below. To cancel this registration, simply hit the 'back' button on your browser.
 
Please remember that we are not responsible for any messages posted. We do not vouch for or warrant the accuracy, completeness or usefulness of any message, and are not responsible for the contents of any message.
 
The messages express the views of the author of the message, not necessarily the views of this bulletin board. Any user who feels that a posted message is objectionable is encouraged to contact us immediately by email. We have the ability to remove objectionable messages and we will make every effort to do so, within a reasonable time frame, if we determine that removal is necessary.
 
You agree, through your use of this service, that you will not use this bulletin board to post any material which is knowingly false and/or defamatory, inaccurate, abusive, vulgar, hateful, harassing, obscene, profane, sexually oriented, threatening, invasive of a person's privacy, or otherwise violative of any law.
 
You agree not to post any copyrighted material unless the copyright is owned by you or by this bulletin board.
 
Our websites use cookies to distinguish you from other users of our website. This helps us to provide you with a personalised experience when you browse this site. For detailed information on the cookies we use and the purposes for which we use them see our cookie policy (link at the footer of each page).

setting.conf_description: Enter the name of your privacy policy. This will also be used in the link.

setting.conf_default:
Your privacy is important to us. To better protect your privacy we provide this notice explaining our online information practices and the choices you can make about the way your information is collected and used. To make this notice easy to find, we make it available in our footer and at every point where personally identifiable information may be requested.

Log files are maintained and analysed of all requests for files on this website's web servers. Log files do not capture personal information but do capture the user's IP address, which is automatically recognised by our web servers.

Our Commitment to Children's Privacy
Protecting the privacy of the very young is especially important. For that reason, we never collect or maintain information at our website from those we actually know are under 13, and no part of our website is structured to attract anyone under 13.

Cookies
This website does not store any information that would, on its own, allow us to identify individual users of this service without their permission. Any cookies that may be used by this website are used either solely on a per session basis or to maintain user preferences. Cookies are not shared with any third parties.

setting.conf_title_desc: Use this setting to turn switch your community online or offline, and to leave a message for your visitors.

setting.conf_description: The community will still be accessible by those who have permission (settable from the Manage User Groups page).

setting.conf_title_desc: This section allows you to comply with COPPA.

setting.conf_description: Enabling COPPA on your board will require children under the age of 13 to get parental consent via a faxed or mailed form.

setting.conf_title: Fax number to receive COPPA forms
Mail address to receive COPPA forms

setting.conf_description: This text will be displayed on the parental consent form and can be used to include your privacy policy (a requirement for COPPA compliance)

setting.conf_title_desc: This section allows you to manage your copyright removal key.

setting.conf_description: Your copyright removal key obtained from IPS.

setting.conf_title_desc: This section allows certain features to be limited or removed to get more performance out of your board.

setting.conf_description: Will display 'busy' message when limit hit. Can be left blank for no limit
Some web accelerators can "prefetch" pages before users request them. Will feel faster for the user if the page is then requested, but can waste server resources if it isn't.
If 'yes', then content set out below will be cached to save resources.
Enter the number of days to cache posts for. Enter 0 to not cache.
Enter the number of days to cache members' signatures for. Enter 0 to not cache.

setting.conf_title: Allow custom profile field info be used in topic view
setting.conf_description: If set to "yes", this will add a LEFT JOIN onto the custom profile field table.

setting.conf_title: Cut off for active user display [in minutes]

setting.conf_description: If enabled, the topic views counter will be updated as one loads a topic. If not enabled, the topic views will be written to another table and the topic views updated every 3 hours. This will significantly reduce overhead on the topics table if you have a very busy board as it overcomes the write lock initiated when the topic counter is updated.

setting.conf_title: Mark topics a user has posted when displaying a forum

setting.conf_description: Number of seconds after a search has started that IP.Board should try to kill the query if the user has left the page. Enter 0 to disable.
This saves 1 query per forum view
This saves 1 query per topic view
Do you wish to disable the topic summary from displaying at the bottom of the post reply page?

setting.conf_title: Allow users (where allowed) to use search

setting.conf_description: Show the community statistic totals at the footer of the forum index page.
Do you wish to disable subforums from displaying on the board index?
Enabling this setting causes the prototype and scriptaculous javascript files to be loaded from Google's servers instead of your own.
If 'yes', IP.Board will manage your read topics in the database so that they are available on different computers.
After the specified number of days, items will appear as read.
Cookies are used to track markers for guests. You can completely disable topic marking for guests so everything appears as read.

setting.conf_title_desc: This section contains the date and time formats used throughout the board.

setting.conf_description: If you have chosen the correct timezone and the clock is an hour out, this is because of daylight savings time and your members can correct this by editing their 'Board settings' via their User Control Panel.

You fine tune the server time. If you need to subtract minutes from the server time, start the number with a '-' (no quotes)
Community time (inc. above time zone and current adj.) is now: <-T->
Would use 'today' and 'yesterday' in posts / last post info
setting.conf_extra: 0=No 1=Yes ( Today & Yesterday ) 2=Yes ( Last X Minutes, Today & Yesterday) 3=Yes ( Full, minutes, hours & days )

setting.conf_description: {--} Will be replaced with 'today' or 'yesterday'
When daylight saving time auto-detection is enabled, your member's profiles will be automatically updated with the correct time.
The format here is the same as PHP's strftime
The format here is the same as PHP's strftime
The format here is the same as PHP's strftime
The format here is the same as PHP's strftime
The format here is the same as PHP's strftime
The format here is the same as PHP's strftime

setting.conf_title_desc: This section will allow you to change the incoming and outgoing email addresses as well as the email method.

setting.conf_description: If PHP's mail() isn't available, choose SMTP. If you are unsure, please ask your web host.
If enabled, HTML formatted emails will be sent out with a plain text alternative so that if the email client doesn't support HTML then the email can still be read.
This is the email address that all incoming mail is addressed to.
This is the email address that all mail appears to come from.
Default is 'localhost'
Default is 25
Some SMTP mailers require that email addresses are in the following format '<' address '>' (no quotes). If you are getting errors in the mail error log, enabled this option
Not required in most cases when using 'localhost'
Not required in most cases when using 'localhost'
Select which identification clause you need to use with your SMTP server.
Example: -femail@address.com will force a 'From' header.

setting.conf_title_desc: These settings control the basics of the board such as URLs and paths.

setting.conf_description: This is the name of the community. It is used as the first link in the navigation menu, etc.

Facebook and other services use this when sharing links or syndicating content. Maximum size is 50px x 50px, with an aspect ratio of 3:1. {style_image_url} will be replaced with URL to current skin directory.
This is the name of your website. If this and "Website Address' is filled in, your website address and name will appear on the community above the header by default.
This is the URL to your website. If entered, it'll appear on the community above the header by default.

Override the form action for uploads. This is useful in a load-balanced environment to force uploaded files to a specific server. (Most users can leave this blank)
Ex: http://master.mysite.com/forums
This is a path, not a URL. <!--SUGGEST-->
The URL to your "uploads" folder. <!--SUGGEST-->

This can be left blank
This is useful for specifing a PATH for the IP.Board written files (skin_cache, style_emoticons, style_images) when dealing with load balanced/clustered servers. If you enter a PATH, please ensure that it ends with a trailing slash.
Note: This location must have a 'cache' folder. So if you enter /home/path/ then you must have a folder /home/path/cache/

This can be left blank
If you supplied a Caching PATH, you must also supply the URL to this caching path here.

You can minify javascript and CSS to reduce the number of HTTP requests to the server, support proper browser caching, and compress the contents sent. Note, if you are using a CDN, you will need to disable this.

This can be left blank
This can be used if you wish to serve images from a different server, using a CDN, or when using clustered servers. Please ensure that you use a trailing slash and that it starts with http(s):// if entering a URL

This can be left blank
This can be used if you wish to serve CSS files from a different server, using a CDN, or when using clustered servers. Please ensure that you use a trailing slash and that it starts with http(s):// if entering a URL

This can be left blank
This can be used if you wish to serve Javascript files from a different server, using a CDN, or when using clustered servers. Please ensure that you use a trailing slash and that it starts with http(s):// if entering a URL
This controls the debug information shown at the footer of your board.
setting.conf_extra: 0=0: None - Don't show any debug information 1=1: Show server load, page generation times and query count 2=2: Show level 1 (above) and GET and POST information 3=3: Show level 1 + 2 and database queries

setting.conf_description: Example: Matthew Mecham, IPS, Inc. If blank, licensed to line will not show.
Removes the board index navigation link when not in the forum application.
Contains the timestamp of the last style change done to the mobile app
Enable webdav so skins are editable outside the ACP.

This is the IPB registraton key NOT your customer code or client center password. To get your key, log into your client center and click on 'Invision Power Board' under 'Your Purchases'.
DO NOT REMOVE OR EDIT THIS KEY UNLESS YOU'RE SURE OF WHAT YOU'RE DOING!

setting.conf_title_desc: Hidden settings

setting.conf_description: If 'yes', this IP.Board will authenticate against IP.Converge.
The root URL of the converge application.
The product ID assigned from the IP.Converge server

setting.conf_title_desc: Settings for the iPhone application

setting.conf_description: Mobile notifications require an active support license
Select which groups can receive mobile notifications, not selecting any will cause notifications to be enabled for all groups.

setting.conf_title_desc: Manage IP.Board's various logs

setting.conf_description: Do you wish to prune spam logs regularly (default every 30 days)?
Do you wish to prune spider logs regularly (default every 30 days)?
Do you wish to prune task logs regularly (default every 30 days)?
Do you wish to prune admin logs regularly (default every 30 days)?
Do you wish to prune moderator logs regularly (default every 30 days)?
Do you wish to prune email logs regularly (default every 30 days)?
Do you wish to prune email error logs regularly (default every 30 days)?
Do you wish to prune SQL Error logs older than 30 days?
Prunes admin login logs over configured days.
Prune error logs over 30 days old?
Log all errors over the selected level
setting.conf_extra: 0=Do not log any additional errors 1=Log all errors 2=Log all level 1 errors and above 3=Log all level 2 errors and above 4=Log all level 3 errors and above 5=Log all level 4 errors and above 6=Log all level 5 errors

setting.conf_description: Notify the community incoming email address when an error is logged?
setting.conf_extra: 0=Do not notify of any errors 1=Notify of all errors 2=Notify of all level 1 errors and above 3=Notify of all level 2 errors and above 4=Notify of all level 3 errors and above 5=Notify of all level 4 errors and above 6=Notify of all level 5 errors

setting.conf_title_desc: Settings to optimize your site for search engine indexing

setting.conf_description: If you're under heavy attack, switch this off as it may put a little extra load on the SQL server as it attempts to insert new data rows.

setting.conf_title: Show search engine in the active users list
Redirect to new friendly URL format
setting.conf_description: If enabled, a user accessing showxxxx=x type links will be automatically redirected to the new URL format.

If you're using PHP as an Apache module you can use 'path info' or you can use 'query string' if you're on Windows hosting or using PHP as a CGI module. Not sure?
Use 'query_string'.
If yes, add a file called .htaccess with the following contents.
Specify the title to use for the forum index page. If left blank, the "Community name" setting will be used
Specify the meta description you would like to use on the board index
Specify the meta keywords you would like to use on the board index

setting.conf_title_desc: This section contains settings for your IPB's search system

setting.conf_description: You can use traditional or sphinx searching (if available).
Only applies to traditional search. If you are using traditional search, this is recommended, but may not find non-English words if the database is not configured properly.
Allowing shorter search words can return more results, such as 'if', 'at', etc. Note, if using the fulltext search method, your MySQL configuration may override this setting.

setting.conf_title: Limit results for topics and posts searching
setting.conf_description: Choose the maximum number of results returned when searching for posts and topics. Note, this only affects 'traditional search' and not Sphinx.

setting.conf_title: Number of search results to show per page
setting.conf_description: Default is 25

setting.conf_title: View New Content: Use SQL Always
setting.conf_description: If 'yes', then the SQL method of fetching results for view new content will be used even if Sphinx is selected for the main search. This negates the 15 minute delay in result updates caused by Sphinx.
Select the forums you don't wish to search for new posts when using either the 'get active topics' or 'view new posts' links. You may select more than one.
If you searched for "foo bar" 'OR' matching would find all results with either keyword, 'AND' matching would find all results with both keywords. Affects 'traditional' searching only.

setting.conf_extra: unread=Content I have not read lastvisit=New since my last visit

setting.conf_description: If you are using manual search and your SQL server supports fulltext searching, a note is shown on the admin home page. You can manually hide it by changing this to yes.

setting.conf_title: Limit "My Content" results to X days
setting.conf_description: If you have a large post or topic database then you may wish to restrict the search to X days past the user's last post date. So if the user last posted in March and you entered 30 days, it would start looking from February onwards.
The address of your Sphinx server, 127.0.0.1 by default.
The port used to connect to your Sphinx server, 3312 by default.
Base path for sphinx indexes and logs

Allows you to use a prefix for the Sphinx indexes from this community. Useful if you run multiple communities on the same server using Sphinx and wish to combine the indexes to only run one Sphinx daemon.

If enabled "exam*" will match "example", "exams", etc. When enabled, re-indexing can be up to ten times slower which may be an issue when re-indexing a very large busy community. After you have changed this setting, please rebuild your sphinx.conf file

setting.conf_title_desc: These options allow you to adjust the security and privacy options for your board.

setting.conf_description: If enabled, this will check the X_FORWARDED_FOR headers to match the user's IP address. This is useful in a intranet situation if the REMOTE_ADDR will be the same across the network. It will also help maintain AOL sessions but can be abused to forge incorrect headers to report an incorrect IP address. If unsure, leave off.
Please choose which lost password method you wish to use. We recommend using 'Email random password' as it's the most secure method.
setting.conf_extra: random=Email random password choose=Allow user to enter new password

setting.conf_description: It is advised that a member's log in key (used in cookies for persistent log in) expires weekly if not used. This increases the security of your board by exposing log in data for a week limiting the time frame a hacker would have to use the key if stolen.
setting.conf_extra: 0=Do not expire (not recommended) 3=Expire after 3 days 7=Expire after 7 days 30=Expire after 30 days

setting.conf_description: Removes inactive sessions over the limit you specify. The lower the number the less chance of a session being hijacked.

setting.conf_title: Match user's IP address during session validation
setting.conf_description: If 'yes', the IP address of the user must match the one stored in the sessions table for security. Only use 'no' in an intranet environment where many users share the same IP address.

setting.conf_title: Match user's browser during session validation
setting.conf_description: This further reduces the risk of session hijacking and tampering but it does mean that a user will have their session terminated if they use another browser at the same time.

setting.conf_title: Lock user account after how many failed login attempts
setting.conf_description:
How many failed login attempts should a user be allowed before the account is locked?
Tip: Set to 0 to disable

setting.conf_title: Reset failed login attempts after how many minutes
setting.conf_description:
Reset the login attempts after how many minutes?
Tip: Set to 0 to not reset failed login attempts until a succesful login occurs

If an account is locked due to failed login attempts, do you wish for the account to unlock after the defined time period has passed since their failed login attempt?
Tip: Setting this to no will require you to manually unlock accounts under the Members tab

setting.conf_title: Remove the ACP link from the community
setting.conf_description: If 'yes', the ACP link will not be displayed in the community header. This is useful if you rename the default 'admin' folder.
This setting forces login requests to the https version of the forums. You MUST first ensure SSL works for your domain (contact your host if unsure).

Make an administrator manually preview all new accounts or make new users validate their email address. If "User then Admin" validation is selected, the user receives a validation email. On successful user validation, the user is entered into the administration approval queue.
setting.conf_extra: admin_user=User then Admin Validation user=User Email Validation admin=Admin Validation 0=None

setting.conf_title: Remove incomplete registration validations after [x] days
setting.conf_description: This will automatically remove all unvalidated members after the number of days you specify. Enter "0" to not automatically remove unvalidated members.

setting.conf_title: Get notified when a new user registers via email
setting.conf_description: This will send an email to the community incoming email address when a new user successfully registers on the community.

setting.conf_title: Force guests to log in before allowing access to the community
setting.conf_description: If set to yes, any guest must either log in or register before they can view the community.
Specifies which registrations are disabled.
setting.conf_extra: 0=No 1=Disable IP.Board registrations only 2=Disable All (IP.Board, Twitter, Facebook, etc)

setting.conf_description: Can be used as a 'hidden' space to emulate registered names - but can cause problems in non Western character sets.

Make users wait before posting again
Can be left blank for no flood control and does not apply to members which belong to a group that can bypass flood control.

setting.conf_title: Allow users to browse the active users list
setting.conf_description: If set to "yes", members and guests will be able to determine the whereabouts of each other by viewing the online list. Topics and forums that the viewer does not have permission to see are not shown.
Do you wish to disable members' ability to login anonymously?

setting.conf_title: Display IP.Board version on your site
setting.conf_description: Do you wish to display the version of IP.Board you are running in your copyright footer?

setting.conf_title_desc: These settings help tailor your output based on your server's settings.

setting.conf_description: This is the "charset" for all ACP and public documents. We strongly recommend UTF-8
Select the method to use for character set conversion. Not all methods supported on all servers. Only applies to non-English languages.
setting.conf_keywords: multibyte, utf8, utf-8, charset, recode, iconv, mb, internal

setting.conf_description: Disables sending of text through AJAX. Useful for sites that use character sets not fully supported by PHP to prevent native characters being saved as HTML entities.
This setting is automatically set during installation but you can override the setting here if you wish. Safe mode skins & languages do not cache to PHP files and uses the database exclusively.
GZIP enables faster page transfers and lower bandwidth use however some servers are not configured to allow it.
Some NT installations will require this to be turned to 'no'.

(This will stop browsers caching pages)
Note: The previous setting must be enabled for this to have any effect
Please select the method to use when immediately redirecting a page.
setting.conf_extra: location=HTTP Header Location refresh=Windows Refresh Command html=HTML Meta Redirect

setting.conf_description: The username for any HTTP (.htaccess) authentication for this installation.
The password for any HTTP (.htaccess) authentication for this installation.
Use .domain.com for site wide cookies
Useful if you have multiple installations on one URL.

setting.conf_title_desc: Settings for Facebook, Twitter, and other social media sharing tools.

setting.conf_description: You *must* set up a Facebook Application. You can do that here
This is shown on your Application ID after you have created your Facebook application.
This is shown as "Secret" after you have created your Facebook Application.
Please select the default member group that will be used for all new Facebook created accounts. This does not affect members linking their accounts.

Facebook will check pages to ensure they're valid when using the "Like" button or "Share" buttons. Please select the group you'd like it to 'appear' as. You may want to choose 'Members' if you hide forums from guests by default.
Specifies the language Facebook uses for its new Social widgets. Tip: You can usually copy the locale, minus any period and suffix, from your language pack under the Manage Languages page.

Specifies how you wish for the Facebook user's real name to be handled when creating a new forum account via logging in.

You MUST have the setting 'Allow "Display Names"' enabled for this to work, otherwise the real name is enforced.
setting.conf_extra: any=Allow User's Choice prefilled=Allow User's Choice, Real Name Suggested enforced=Enforce Real Name

setting.conf_description: You can set up a Twitter application here
Please select the default member group for new accounts created with Twitter log in.
Share links add icons to the specific pages enabling your members to share links. Note, there is no way to enforce permissions on shared links but you can remove the ability on a per forum basis.

As permissions are not able to be checked on shared items, you may wish to disable any public lists of recently shared links, etc. Access to topics is never granted unless the user has permission but these lists will reveal topic names, etc.

setting.conf_title: Enable "Auto Share" when creating new content
setting.conf_description: When enabled, members will be given the option of automatically sharing their new content (such as a topic) with social media sites. Note: this feature is not used for replies and comments and only in supported applications.

setting.conf_title_desc: Settings to refine the tagging system

setting.conf_description: This will enable the tagging system
An open system allows users to create and add their own tags to content where allowed. A closed system allows admins to define tags on this page that others can use where allowed.
setting.conf_extra: 1=Open System (Create and apply tags ad-hoc) 0=Closed System (Can only use pre-defined tags)

setting.conf_title: Can use a tag as content prefix
setting.conf_description: You can allow the first entered or selected tag to appear as a prefix to the content, such as a topic.
setting.conf_extra: 0=Disable prefixes 1=Admins only can set prefixes 2=Anyone where allowed can set prefixes

setting.conf_description: If you are using the tag system as a closed system, you can create a default set of tags separated by a comma here. Applications may override these where permitted.
You may wish to convert all tags to lowercase before saving.
You may set a minimum number of tags required for each item. Entering 0 will disable any minimum restriction.
You may set a maximum number of tags required for each item. Entering 0 will disable any maximum restriction.
You may require a minimum length per tag. Entering 0 disables any restriction.
You may require a maximum length per tag. Entering 0 disables any restriction.

setting.conf_title: Clean tags via bad word filter
setting.conf_description: If enabled, tags will be cleaned via the bad word filter.

setting.conf_title_desc: Settings to manage your XML-RPC API interface

setting.conf_description: If 'yes' then your API users will be able to use the XML-RPC interface.
Which type of logging do you wish to record? 'All' will record all API access, 'Failed' will only log failed API accesses.
Enter the maximum number of days you wish to keep logs for. For example, if you entered '30' all logs older than 30 days will be removed.
